Subject: Chaos Machine
Description: The Chaos machine returns to shape your wildest engineering imagination into a functioning beacon of collective brilliance. Find some old friends or new acquaintances to help build the machine from the ground up!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Find Tux
Description: Can you find Tux at Penguicon?  Look for the Penguin Plushie and you can keep it!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Find Waldo
Description: Where's Waldo? He's somewhere amidst the rest of the hordes of awesome Penguicon attendees. Look for Waldo and his friend the Wizard anywhere in plain sight. If you find them, you will be rewarded!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Free Fates Fortune Telling Booth
Description: Find a token, bring it to the booth in the lobby, and randomly generated predictions will be given to you! You may also write a short question and receive a Yes or No answer in return. Hours of operation posted at the booth.  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Giant Jenga
Description: Stop by and play some (enormous) Jenga with your friends, or meet new people. No writing dirty things on the blocks! You'll just have to use your imagination.  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Google Ingress Dead Drop
Description: Something special will be hidden in the con area Friday evening. A picture and clue will be posted. If you find it, you can keep it!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: NUET Scouts
Description: The Scouts are at it again! The Nearly Useless Entertainment Team is back for another year at Penguicon, bringing you fun, mayhem, and shenanigans. Find us wandering the con to see what we have planned this year.  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Pengicon Picture Bingo
Description: Snap a picture of each clue and you will be rewarded! Go to Registration, Ops, or the Greeter table to get started!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Retro-style Video Games
Description: Find David Gazdowicz's awesome games in the lobby... and play them!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Ribbon Fairy
Description: Look out for the Ribbon Fairy! If you find her, you can trade her a ribbon for a ribbon!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Where in the World?
Description: Wondering where people are coming from to go to Penguicon?  Stop by and tag the city you came from on the World, US or Michigan map!  Speakers include: - Track: Mayhem  - Duration: 48 hours - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Why Are There So Few Adult American Animated TV Series?
Description: Let's talk about why most U.S. animated series are created for children when there is such a large market for adult animation abroad.  Speakers include: - Track: Anime  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Closet Cosplay
Description: Let's talk about how you can build a costume from what you happen to have on hand. Come share stories about the costumes you didn't know you already had tucked away in the midst of your day to day clothes, or costumes you pulled together in 30 minutes after a run to the hardware store.  Speakers include: - Track: Costuming  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Cosplay Model Figure Illustration
Description: You spent all night/month/year working on your in-depth cosplay of your absolute favorite character. You get to walk around in it, have some pictures taken, and then set it aside until your next Con...or maybe never again. That's just not good enough! Come and model it for some hopeful artists! Cosplayers and artists of all skill-levels, please join us!  Speakers include: - Track: Costuming  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Electronics Projects Show and Tell
Description: Show off electronics projects that you have been working on, and discuss how you made it! Robots! Wearable computers! Arduino! Raspberry Pi! Beaglebone! All and more are welcome. If you cannot bring the physical project to the event, bring a laptop or another way to show it to the group.  Speakers include: - Track: DIY, Tech  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Homesteading
Description: Come and share your homesteading experiences!  Speakers include: - Track: Eco  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Sherlocked!
Description: Modern Sherlock Holmes has addicted much of sf fandom and pro-dom. Join fellow fans for on open discussion of BBC's Sherlock 2010-2014. Includes s3 spoilers. We will ask up front if participants would prefer to avoid discussion of s4 spoilers.  Speakers include: - Track: Film  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Mystery Spatula Theater
Description: Mystery Spatula Theater 11, or MST11 for short, is our own fan version of the popular television show Mystery Science Theater 3000. Although more fromage than homage, the MST11 crew still have fun doing what the 'big boys' do, this time with the 'Fantastic Four'!  Speakers include: - Track: Film  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector, Sound System

Subject:
Zombie Orpheus presents:  The Gamers: Natural One, Humans & Households and 
Dark Dungeons
Description: Zombie Orpheus are a fan supported and creator distributed new media company with a focus on the kind of shows that could never get made in Hollywoodâ€”awesome, nerdy entertainment that you have the power to renew!  Come check out three of their films: 1. The Gamers: Natural One (30 min) Natural One begins with a summons to Gary from his Canadian half-sister, Monica. She's getting married and family tradition calls for her future partner to be vetted in-game-is he gamer enough to be worthy of the family name? 2. Humans & Households (30 min) Humans & Households follows a group of fantasy heroes on their day off  as they sit down to enjoy a rousing role-playing game set in a mundane world of  traffic lights, errant puppies, indoor plumbing, and other diabolical evils. 3. Dark Dungeons (40 min) Two college students are seduced into the evil cult of role playing games.  Speakers include: - Track: Film  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector, Sound System

Subject: BoF: Christians in Fandom
Description: An open discussion for Christians who are fans.  Speakers include: - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Compliments Confidence
Description: Ever had a compliment make your day? Ever wish you'd handled giving -- or getting -- a compliment more gracefully? Let's talk a little about how to compliment someone thoughtfully, and options for responding. Then, we can practice giving and receiving compliments with each other.  Speakers include: - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Nerdy Tatoos
Description: Have you proven your dedication to Star Wars by tattooing Jar Jar Binks on your arm?  A mathmatical equation, a constellation, a formula for your favorite compound, or just the number 42?  Come show off your nerdy tattoo (or get ideas for your very own) in this new birds of a feather!  Speakers include: - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Polyamory
Description: Have a fun discussion with other nerdy people in open relationships of all kinds at this non-directed meetup. Feel free to bring a partner or three.  Speakers include: - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: But Is It Fantasy?
Description: An open discussion about recent works which use Fantasy tropes, but which are not generally considered to fall into the umbrella of the fantasy genre. What defines genre fiction, and why are some works considered too 'mainstream?' Why is fantasy so popular among items aimed at the YA market?  Speakers include: - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: But is it Horror?
Description: An open discussion about recent works which use Horror tropes, but which are not generally considered to fall into the umbrella of the horror genre. What defines genre fiction, and why are some works considered too 'mainstream?' Does the presence of a supernatural being automatically qualify something as horror?  Speakers include: - Track: Literature, Film  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: But is it Sci-Fi?
Description: An open discussion about recent works which use Science Fiction tropes, but which are not generally considered to fall into the umbrella of the science fiction genre. What defines genre fiction, and why are some works considered too 'mainstream?' Why did so many sci-fi fans dislike The Time Traveller's Wife?  Speakers include: - Track: Literature, Film  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: NaNoWriMo Meet-Up
Description: NaNoWriMo, the National Novel Writing Month, is an exhilarating, frustrating, possibly insane idea -- write a 50,000 word novel in one month. One of the amazing aspects of NaNo, and one which sets it apart from the typical, solitary writer life, is the social aspect. Come meet other brave souls who have accepted the NaNo challenge.  Speakers include: - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Research vs. Faking It
Description: You've read it. That book that used Hollywood physics. The story that isn't a spoof but should be. The setting's in your hometown but the author didn't even check Google. Which is worse, an author blowing off research or faking things? What if the faking is done so well you let it slide? What throws you out of the story quicker? What do you wish authors would actually research every time?  Speakers include: - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Shadow Unit Round Table
Description: Are you a fan of the Shadow Unit series by Will Shetterly, Emma Bull, Elizabeth Bear, Sarah Monette, and Kyle Cassidy? Want to discuss the story, geek out about your favorite characters, or dissect the writing techniques? Come help us pick apart and enthuse over this book series!  Speakers include: - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Steampunk
Description: Steampunk is more than a literary and cinematic sub-genre of science fiction. It has become an aesthetic encompassing costuming, diet, and more. Put on your waistcoat and join a discussion of all things steampunk.  Speakers include: - Track: Literature, Costuming  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: #teamswoop Q&A
Description: Who is #teamswoop? What is #teamswoop? Swoop isn't just fun to say. Swoop is a lifestyle. Embrace the swoop. Confused? Come ask questions.  Speakers include:Barbeque, Snesei, Monotony, Walk in Circles, DJ Seanni B,  - Track: Music  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Chip Music Open Mic
Description: Do you fancy yourself a chip artist? Come throw down a few tracks and prove it!  Speakers include: - Track: Music  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Sound System

Subject: Chip Rave w/ #teamswoop
Description: Join #teamswoop for some chiptunes awesomeness!  Speakers include:Barbeque, Snesei, Monotony, Walk in Circles, DJ Seanni B,  - Track: Music  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Projector

Subject: Geek Prom
Description: It's a Timey Wimey prom! Come dressed in your finest formalwear (we've heard bow ties are cool!) or choose a costume from anywhere in space and time and join the Costume Contest! Join us for music, dancing, and fun at Penguicon's Geek Prom! Special performance by DJ Stu!  Speakers include: - Track: Penguicon Events  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: Microphone, Sound System

Subject: BoF: Homestuck
Description: Love homestuck? Hate Homestuck?  No matter how you may feel about it, there is no greater success story in the webcomic world than Homestuck.   Speakers include: - Track: Webcomics  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: GamerGate -- What have we learned?
Description: In the past year, online communities and social networks have fragmented around the stated goals of gender representation and media impartiality when it comes to video games. In a post-GamerGate world, where do we go from here?   Speakers include: - Track: Videogaming  - Duration: 1 hour - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: Storytelling in Video Games
Description: What are the most amazing stories in video games? Let's discuss how gaming is moving toward legitimate art and away from tropes. Some stories can only be told through interaction, and current games about depression, bureaucracy, novel writing, and even being famous on Twitter have to be played to be understood. Stick around for our 'most awful stories in gaming'.  Speakers include: - Track: Videogaming  - Duration: 1 hour - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: BoF: XBox One vs. Playstation 4 -- Who Won" the Next Gen Console War?"
Description: Now that there's been time to experience both the XBox One and the Playstation 4, which system has come out on top?  Speakers include: - Track: Videogaming  - Duration: 1 hour - Audio/video needs: none
